poem:
**The Price of Beauty**  

The flesh trades its gloss,  
A forbidden alchemy whispers  
of youth fashioned from the unseen.  
Cells whisper in clandestine clinics;  
ferried dreams of ageless wonder.  
Yet beneath the lure of soft skin,  
what shadows curl in this pact,  
flesh posing as divine,  
while the soul starves,  
unrejuvenated by the balm.
